section.section: The Department shall establish a producer mobile farmer's market license.

The fee for a producer mobile farmer's market license:
Shall be based on the anticipated cost of licensing, inspecting, and regulating licensees; and
May not exceed $100.
A producer mobile farmer's market license shall be valid for a period of 1 year.

text.section:
A producer mobile farmer's market licensee may transport to and sell at a farmer's market or at a public festival or event:
Products that were produced by the licensee under an on-farm home processing plant license;
Products produced by the licensee, as authorized by the Department in regulation; or
Farm products that have been inspected, licensed, or certified for food safety by the Maryland Department of Agriculture.

section.section: A producer mobile farmer's market license is valid in all jurisdictions in the State.

A county or municipality may not require a producer mobile farmer's market licensee to obtain a separate permit or license to sell products authorized for sale under the producer mobile farmer's market license.

text.section:
The Department shall:
Issue producer mobile farmer's market licenses;
At least once a year, inspect each mobile unit that operates under a producer mobile farmer's market license; and
Adopt regulations to implement this section.
A producer mobile farmer's market license shall be displayed on any mobile unit operating under the license.

section.section: A person in violation of this section or a regulation adopted under this section is subject to a fine not to exceed $1,000.
A county health department shall enforce and levy fines for a violation of this section or any regulations adopted under this section.
Fines assessed by a county health department shall be paid to the county in which the violation occurred.
A county health department shall notify the Department of any violations occurring in the county.
